title: Who started the Black Plague? - Quora

response.answer_text: It originated in China because it was one of the busiest of the world's trading nations. Black rats were transported to western Asia and Europe. The rats were carrying fleas it was the flea bites that caused fever and a painful swelling of the lymph glands called buboes.The disease also causes spots on the skin that are red at first and then turn black. If it spread into the lungs it became airborne so coughing and sneezing caused it to spread very quickly. Hygiene during this time was totally inadequate to put it mildly open sewers, over crowded build up areas, narrow streets recipe for disaster. Medieval medicine had nothing to cope with such an outbreak. The disease spread with alarming speed killing 25 million people in 5 years

The Mongols helped it spread by conquering all these lands.The disease originated from China and Eastern Steppes.The Golden Horde helped it spread with the Siege of Kaffa when the Golden Horde army started falling down to the ground by the disease they thought they were perishing and they ordered to send the dead bodies into the city which when they got in contact with the Italians in Kaffa made them infected,The Italians escaped Kaffa and stopped by Constantinople and got the City infected and later Infected europe through Genoa and started spreading through it so blame the Mongols and the Italians for the spreading.
